ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a lot of Indonesian, learned about Indonesian culture.
I learned how to read, write, and speak Indonesian.
no beating around the bush, great class great professor

I learned a lot about a new place that I had known very little about prior to taking the course. I got to be immersed in the culture, and I got to learn a new language. It is essential to study a language as frequently as possible so that it is better retained in your mind.

I learned a lot about the Indonesian language and culture. I was able to interact with people from Indonesia via zoom to improve my speaking and understanding. We participated in Indonesian celebrations and practices to better understand the culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths are Pak Indriyo. Great professor who keeps students engaged and is very understanding. Weakness is semi disorganized and you dont often know your assignments until the day before/of.
Pak Indriyo and Kak Nia were amazing! I was always excited to go to class.
strengths are that going to class everyday puts a smile on my face
The professors care about their students, and they make an effort to get to know everyone in the course. They are super friendly and understanding while also being super engaging.
This course is exceptionally engaging. I would have liked more organization of this course on canvas.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes 100% - my favorite class at Yale
Yes, I would definitely recommend this course to future students at Yale. I enjoyed going to class each day, and I learned something new almost everyday.
Yes. It is very engaging and an Excellent way to learn more about the Indonesian language and culture.
